title: Git and GitHub Starter Guide
text:
Preface
The following is a quick starter guide designed to get you acquainted with Git and GitHub, our recommended file storage site for your academic and coding work.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
Overleaf is a cloud-based \(\LaTeX\) editor that simplifies the process of writing, editing, and collaborating on \(\LaTeX\) documents. While it is not a super powerful text editor, its ease of use and collaboration features make it a favorite among many users. In fact, many graduate students and professors prefer Overleaf over all other editors.
This starter guide will walk you through getting started in Overleaf, from signing up for an account, to creating projects, collaborating, and much more.

title: 2  Sign Up / Login
text: To begin using Overleaf, visit the website overleaf.com and either sign up for a new account or log in if you already have one. Use your Harvard Google account, as that will provide you with access to Overleaf’s premium subscription, and free templates.
crumbs: Getting Started with Git and GitHub

title: 8  Learning Resources
text:
Overleaf offers extensive documentation, tutorials, and examples to help you learn LaTeX and make the most of its features. Additionally, there are numerous online resources, forums, and communities dedicated to LaTeX where you can seek help and advice.
For example, when you first start using Overleaf, you may find overleaf.com/learn to be especially helpful. This documentation has a guide for anything that you may wish to do in Overleaf!
